extractions.reasoning: 8 is the size (in bytes) of a double on typical platforms. Naming this clarifies the allocation intent and avoids hardcoding a type size; using sizeof(double) would be even better.
12 is the byte size of the dim3-like struct (three uint32_t fields). Using a named size prevents subtle bugs if the struct layout changes and documents the intent of the memcpys.
256 configures the x-dimension thread block size and related loop bounds for kernel1. A named constant conveys its role and makes tuning easier.
